title.rendered: Hamas Compound Embedded Inside UNRWA School in Nuseirat Targeted by IAF

content.rendered:
Earlier today, IAF fighter jets, guided by IDF intelligence and the ISA, executed a precise strike on a Hamas compound embedded within an UNRWA school in the Nuseirat area. The compound housed Hamas and Islamic Jihad terrorists, including members of the Nukhba Forces who participated in the brutal October 7th attacks on southern Israeli communities.

These terrorists were using the school as a base to direct and plan further terrorist activities against IDF troops. Several operatives, who were in the process of planning imminent attacks, were eliminated in the strike. Extensive precautions, including aerial surveillance and additional intelligence gathering, were taken beforehand to minimize the risk to uninvolved civilians during the operation.

Terrorists Who Were Eliminated During the Strike


Abed Alati Masmeh – Islamic Jihad military operative
Mosab Hafez Darwish – Hamas military operative in the Nukhba Forces
Salem Afesh – Islamic Jihad military operative in the Nukhba Forces
Rashed Bubly – Hamas military operative in the Nukhba Forces
Ahmed Salah Mansur – Islamic Jihad military operative in the engineering field
Muhammad Mutasab – Islamic Jihad military operative
Ahmed Khatib – Islamic Jihad military operative in the Artillery Unit
Muhammad Barham – Islamic Jihad military operative responsible for security and operations
Ali Hasan Bana – Islamic Jihad military operative


Ahmad Shahdeh Muhammed Abu Mhimar – Hamas aerial defense operative who participated in the October 7th attacks
Maher Mahmoud ‘Abd al-Fattah Fadel – Hamas military operative
Jamil Suleiman Maqadama – Hamas military operative in the Nukhba Forces
Shahin Mahmoud Abu al-Sharif – Islamic Jihad military operative
Sa’id Muhammed Ahmad ‘Issa – Terror operative
Magd ‘Atef Muhammed Darwish – Hamas Central Camps Aerial Array operative
Mazen Hassan ‘Aqab Abu Zaher – Hamas military operative
Moatasem Mufeed Muhammed Shakra – Hamas military operative
